sub_topic: Predicting the solubility of inorganic salts in water
message_1: What is the solubility of NaCl (sodium chloride) in water at a temperature of 25°C and atmospheric pressure?
message_2: The solubility of NaCl (sodium chloride) in water at 25°C and atmospheric pressure is approximately 357 grams per liter (g/L). This means that at this temperature and pressure, 357 grams of NaCl can dissolve in 1 liter of water before the solution becomes saturated.
